Description: Guardian Life agreed to pay $2 million to settle multistate litigation regarding its use of the Social Security Administration's Death Master File.
Info Source: Two Additional Insurers Agree to Appropriate Use of Death Master File, States News Service, March 23, 2015 (via Nexis).

Company: Guardian Life Insurance Company of America
Description: To resolve a case involving allegations of unfair health insurance reimbursement rates, Guardian Life agreed to pay $500,000 to a qualified nonprofit organization that would establish a new, independent database to help determine fair out-of-network reimbursement rates for consumers throughout the United States.

Company: The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America

Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
Info Source: N.Y. REGULATORS FINE GUARDIAN LIFE $250,000, Bestwire, January 7, 2000 (via Nexis).
Notes: At the time of this case the agency was known as the New York Insurance Department.

Company: Guardian Life Insurance Company of America
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Company: The Guardian Insurance & Annuity Company, Inc.
Description: The Department of Financial Services entered into consent orders with six life insurance companies to resolve alleged violations of New York Insurance Regulations in deferred to immediate annuity replacement transactions.  The insurers, collectively, agreed  to pay $1,152,154 in restitution and $673,000 in penalties.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Company: Guardian Life Insurance Company of America

Description: $5,000 fine levied for failing to timely file rates in 39 instances.
